derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (as an adjective): from late Latin additivus, from Latin addit- 'added', from the verb addere (see add)The noun dates from the 1940s

entry.def: An additive is a substance which is added in small amounts to foods or other things in order to improve them or to make them last longer.

example.ex: Strict safety tests are carried out on food additives.
example.tran: 对食品添加剂进行了严格的安全检测。
不含添加剂的婴儿食品

means.word_mean: 1. something added to enhance food or gasoline or paint or medicine
2. designating or involving an equation whose terms are of the first degree
